Title: Binding from Three Collections of Poetry
Dimensions: Folio H: 11 x W: 7 1/2 in. (28 x 19 cm)
Description: This non-original, red leather binding from Walters manuscript W.657 has a central medallion, pendants, and cornerpieces (with no flap). The binding has gold-painted arabesque decoration. It was re-bound and restored by a bookbinder of Tabriz, Khwand Mulla Mahdi Sahhaf-i Tabrizi (see note, signed and dated 1295 AH/AD 1878 on front flyleaf iia).
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Book; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; India; Iran; History; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Mundir [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [seal impression with motton on fol. 280b]; Khwand Mulla Mahdi Sahhaf-i Tabrizi, Tabriz, 1295 AH/AD 1878 [mode of acquisition unknown] [note regarding re-binding and restoration of this volume by the bookbinder on front flyleaf iia]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Khwand Mulla Mahdi Sahhaf-i Tabrizi (Iranian, active 1295 AH/AD 1878)
